intro: Pleragina rufa, commonly known as the red-flowered bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pleragina rufa thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
